Closed issue "Change iframe src more than once ,  will not back to previous page" (#1917) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsbin.com/hikorawipa/edit?html,output](http://jsbin.com/hikorawipa/edit?html,output)

### Steps to reproduce
- Home to Iframe
- Click Bootstrap, loaded
- Click Vue, loaded
- Click Back button(go(-1)), will not back to Home, but the Bootstrap

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11537595/33467812-37895d76-d692-11e7-8f17-b0a9374198cb.gif)


### What is expected?
Do not push iframe history into router

### What is actually happening?
If change iframe src more than once (loaded),  then `go(-1)` will not back to previous page

---
- find in v2.2.0, v3.0.1 too
- Chrome 62.0.3202.94

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Store is not a constructor" (#1068) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/jpjq08vzv9](https://codesandbox.io/s/jpjq08vzv9)

### Steps to reproduce
Install npm dependancies and run webpack.

### What is expected?
See vue homepage with hello world message

### What is actually happening?
The bug doesn't appear on sandbox but on my local machine I've following error : O is not a constructor.
This bug concerns new Vuex.Store line.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update testing.md" (#1074) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody: Word 'can' implies the user has a choice to do that or not, but in this case it is obligatory to export the mutations as a named export. Took me a while to make the test work :)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Update testing.md" (#1074) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody: Word 'can' implies the user has a choice to do that or not, but in this case it is obligatory to export the mutations as a named export. Took me a while to make the test work :)
